cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Savannah, Georgia
cyclone.trajectory: moving north just offshore the Georgia coast, then forecast to curve north-northeast and parallel the South Carolina and southern North Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of Charleston, South Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City to Cape Lookout, NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Fernandina Beach, FL to Surf City, NC (includes entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida, Georgia, South Carolina and southern North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts (≥74 mph) possible with sustained tropical-storm winds (39–73 mph) through early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 6–9 ft possible along the immediate Georgia coastline including Brunswick River entrance
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could produce flash flooding around the port area
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents and minor tornado threat in outer rainbands
